channel.title: B&W film on Grainy Photos
channel.description: Recent content in B&W film on Grainy Photos

item.title: Verdeña and the El Bosque Fósil walk
item.description: A photoblog about Verdeña, a village in the Montaña Palentina region, 15 km from Cervera de Pisuerga. Known for the nearby El Bosque Fósil walk, Verdeña stands at an altitude of about 1239 m.

item.title: Alba de los Cardaños
item.description: Photoblog about Alba de los Cardaños in Palencia, Spain. A rustic village in a scenic mountain landscape with great environmental value.

item.title: El Torcal de Antequera, Spain
item.description: Fifteen photos from El Torcal de Antequera, an area of outstanding natural beauty and arguably the best examples of karst limestone formation in Europe.

item.title: El Acebuchal, the lost village
item.description: Everything you need to know about El Acebuchal. The photographs were shot on Kentmere film with a vintage Mamiya M645 camera.

item.title: Classic Car Show
item.description: Photos from the Classic Car Show in Martos, October 2024. The photos were shot on Kentnere 100 film using a vintage Zeis Ikon Ikoflex camera.

item.title: A photo walk around Soportújar
item.description: Soportújar, often called the “Village of Witches, is a small white village in the Alpujarra region of Spain. Find out more, with thirty-seven film photos.”

item.title: A stroll above Soportújar (Dam 24)
item.description: A spectacular walk high above Soportújar with stunning views. See 15 film photos shot with a Nikon FE2 from the walk, including the impressive 30 m waterfall on the Chico River.

item.title: Potes
item.description: A tour of Potes with 21 film photos. Potes is a picturesque town in the foothills of the Picos de Europa mountain range, offering history, stunning natural scenery and outdoor recreational opportunities.

item.title: Ronda
item.description: Find out about Ronda in Spain, known for its stunning scenery, rich history, and cultural heritage - includes fifteen film photos of the most famous landmarks.

item.title: Mogarraz
item.description: Twenty black-and-white film photos from Mogarraz taken with vintage cameras. Mogarraz is one of my favourite villages in Spain; it has history, is very picturesque, has a great location, and oozes charm.

item.title: Frigiliana
item.description: Frigiliana is a picture-postcard white village in Southern Spain - see twenty-four B&W film photos taken with a Mamiya M645 film camera on Ilford FP4 film.

item.title: Harman Phoenix 200 colour film – first impressions
item.description: My first impressions of the Harman Phoenix 200 colour film, a brand-new ISO 200, C41 colour experimental film with high contrast, strong visible grain and loads of character.

item.title: Genalgaucil
item.description: Genalguacil is a classic Andalusian white town with a difference - it is famous for its street art! A photo walk with 23 film photos taken with vintage cameras.

item.title: Nerja
item.description: Nerja is a picturesque coastal resort town approximately 50 kilometres east of Málaga, Spain. 16 film photos shot on Ilford FP4 with a Mamiya M645

item.title: Citroen 2CV photos with the Mamiya RB67
item.description: I love classic cars and film cameras, so I jumped at the chance of photographing a Citroën 2CV with my Mamiya RB67 vintage film camera - see all the film photos.

item.title: First film with the Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa 855/16
item.description: Eleven photos of an old Cortijo (Spanish farmhouse) - the first roll of Ilford FP4 film through my Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa.
